meanings.definition: Belief in the coming of a golden age or paradise on earth.
meanings.sent1: Many people hold onto millennialism as a hope for a better future.
meanings.sent2: Millennialism is the belief that a perfect world will one day exist.
meanings.sent3: The idea of millennialism brings a sense of optimism to those who embrace it.
meanings.sent4: In literature, millennialism is often portrayed as a utopian dream.
meanings.sent5: The concept of millennialism paints a vivid picture of an ideal society.

meanings.definition: The doctrine of the Second Coming of Christ and the establishment of a kingdom of God on earth.
meanings.sent1: Millennialism teaches that Christ will return to establish a divine kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The belief in millennialism centers around the idea of Christ's Second Coming.
meanings.sent3: Some find comfort in the certainty of millennialism's promise of Christ's return.
meanings.sent4: The concept of millennialism serves as a beacon of hope for many believers.
meanings.sent5: Millennialism's focus on Christ's return creates a powerful image of divine intervention.
